message: My 160Gb (6g) iPod is now full. As far as I can tell nobody makes a music player that's bigger than 160Gb. The old 5g can be upgraded with a very expensive 240Gb disk, but software limits mean the OS may crap out before you fill it. The big disk doesn't fit the 6g iPod. Apple don't seem to be showing any interest in upgrading the Classic.
buy an iphone and subscribe to spotify
that's what I did when my iPod went full
they make a product with 250 go, but i can't believe you success to fully use 160 go !
Well I'm currently up to 25533 tracks and 0.9Gb free. I've grown used to having all my music in my pocket all the time.  I can get clever with auto-fill but it's not the same.

At some time in the past I had a Creative Zen with a 2.5" disk. It was a bit of a brick, but 2.5" disks are cheap and huge now. However it also needs an OS that can handle very large numbers of tracks.
Have a friend who's solution to this is a 2Tb portable hard disk  in a backpack. But that's ridiculous and not really feasible for listening on  a M/C or Bicycle, in a car or while commuting.
I'm in the same boat... my solution is to have two ipod classics
Just forget and relax - it will be never enough anyways :)
